name: Kerson Leong, violin
description:
Winner of the prestigious International Menuhin Violin Competition, Kerson Leong has been described as "not just one of Canada's greatest violinists but one of the greatest violinists, period". 

He has performed with Brussels, Oslo, Royal Philharmonic and Istanbul, Singapore, Toronto, Wuppertal and Montréal Symphony Orchestras. As a sought-after soloist, Kerson has appeared at Carnegie and Wigmore Halls, Auditorium du Louvre, and National Center for the Performing Arts, Beijing. 

He plays the 'ex Bohrer, Baumgartner' Guarneri del Gesu violin courtesy of Canimex Inc. Drummondville.

His virtuosic recital includes violin works by Ysaÿe (Sonata No. 3 "Ballade" & Sonata No. 4 in E minor), Kreisler's Recitativo and Scherzo, and Bach's Chaconne from Partita No. 2.
